snippet: The Internal Revenue Service is delaying the date for accepting returns by eight days because it had to wait for the fiscal agreement on taxes that Congress reached on Jan. 1.
abstract: Internal Revenue Service says that taxpayers can begin filing their 2012 returns on Jan 30, eight days later than originally planned due to last-minute changes that Congress made to tax laws at the beginning of the year.
lead_paragraph: The Internal Revenue Service is delaying the date for accepting returns by eight days because it had to wait for the fiscal agreement on taxes that Congress reached on Jan. 1.
